str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and phoneo; to sound towards, i.e. Address, exclaim, summon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
